### Description of variable
This section will describe the attributes for each columns:
<br><br>
‣***Diagnosis***: Display the prediction of diagnosis where: *0= Malignant, 1=Benign* <br>
‣***Radius_M***: Mean of distances from center to points on the perimeter <br>
‣***Texture_M***: The standard deviation of grayscale value <br>
‣***Perimeter_M***: Perimeter of cell <br>
‣***Area_M***: Area of cell <br>
‣***Smootheness_M***: Local variation in radius lengths <br>
‣***Compactness_M***: The perimeter^2/ area-1.0 <br>
‣***Concavity_M***: Severity of concave portions of the contour <br>
‣***ConcavePoint_M***: Number of concave points of the contour <br>
‣***Symmetry_M***: Mean for perimeter of samples collected <br>
‣***FractalDimension_M***: "Coastline approximation" -1 <br>
<br>
The features includes mean, standard error and "worst"(mean of the three largest values). For instance, mean radius, radius standard error and worst radius.
